title: Lowest Common Ancestor
description:
Find the Lowest Common Ancestor (LCA) of two nodes in a tree.

The LCA is the lowest node that has both nodes as descendants (a node can be a descendant of itself).

## Input Format
- First line: n (number of nodes, 0-indexed)
- Next n-1 lines: parent child (tree edges)
- Last line: node1 node2 (query nodes)

## Output Format
- Single integer: LCA of node1 and node2
constraints:
- 2 ≤ n ≤ 100,000
- 0 ≤ node < n
- Valid tree structure (connected, acyclic)
